oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Field Evaluation of a Mycoplasma bovis Bacterin in Young Dairy Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Maunsell, Fiona
Donovan, Art
Risco, Carlos
Brown, Mary
Hernandez, Jorge
Lanhart, Shelly
Bray, David
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mycoplasma bovis
vaccinated
weight gain
nasal colonization
serum immunoglobulin
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this field trial was to determine the efficacy of a commercially produced Mycoplasma bovis (Mb) bacterin for the prevention of Mb-associated disease (respiratory disease, otitis media, arthritis) and mortality in dairy calves from birth to 90. days of age. Additional objectives were to compare vaccinated and placebo-treated calves with respect to 1) weight gain from birth to 90 days of age, 2) rates of nasal colonization by Mb and 3) Mb-specific serum immunoglobulin concentrations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2003; 173
